title: Adding data
text: simplified explanation R packages data chapter. fuller understanding, read chapter. data: R datasets go data folder inst/extdata: Non-R datasets go inst>extdata folder. internal data: build package, Rda datasets (data folder) can become “internal” (efficient file storage). accessed calling package::dataset (e.g.  appliedepidata::AJS_AmTiman. can also imported directly github using link file data folder e.g. ‘rio()’, appliedepidata::get_data appliedepidata::save_data functions. data-raw: Contains R scripts used creating exported internal data (e.g. edited dataset used {usethis} internalise dataset) sysdata: relevant current package setup. setups supposed put tableoftables sysdata (.e. just package usage). However current setup leave extdata.
code: . ├── appliedepidata.Rproj ├── _pkgdown.yml ├── data │   └── newdata.rda ├── data-raw │   └── newdata.R ├── inst │   └── extdata │       └── tableoftables.xlsx │       └── newdata.xlsx ├── R │   └── newdata_doc.R └── man     └── newdata.Rd

title: Adding data
text: describes process adding file repo. Note processes adding non-R file (file .rda) R file (file already .rda format) slightly different. adding dataset existing R package, can skip step 3 . Name file appropriately can name whatever want, stick basic naming conventions. Ensure already file tableoftables.xlsx named . Avoid generic names like: linelist_cleaned.xlsx survey_data.xlsx. Use consistent descriptive names without spaces (e.g., AJS_AmTiman, sitrep_mortality_survey). Place file correct folder non-R file (e.g. xlsx, shp, zip) goes inst/extdata folder . adding shapefile zip R file (e.g. rda, rds) goes data folder Reproducibly edit dataset internalise (see data-raw/AJS_AmTiman.R example) console run usethis::use_data_raw(<name file without extension>) creates R script data-raw folder. Read file defining path system.file. . editing file already package (e.g. shortening Ebola linelist course), make sure read original dataset . Document properly {roxygen} metadata described . Make edits necessary dataset reproducible way. Save internalise dataset usethis::usedata(). Add documentation dataset added done R script R folder. Name script something allow reviewers find (e.g. AJS_chad) suffix _doc can differentiated functions. Place documentation datasets group within script. Ensure clearly document source license dataset. Add explanation variable, data dictionary use appliedepidata::create_desc() help . . also create data dictionary use function, see data dictionary walk-Add datasets _pkgdown.yml Group relevant datasets subtitle (suffix language) names correspond name quotations end description file point 4 , well name file (without file extension). Add dataset tablesoftables.xlsx described .

title: Adding data
text: table explaining fill variable dataset metadata Excel sheet (tablesoftables.xlsx). guide helps ensure consistency completeness adding new datasets collection. name: filename dataset appears inst/extdata directory, without file extension. unique within dataset group, ideally also within tableoftables (.e. avoid generic names like: linelist_cleaned.xlsx survey_data.xlsx). Use consistent descriptive names without spaces (e.g., AJS_AmTiman, mortality_survey). type: category type dataset (e.g., linelist, population, shape, survey, dictionary). extension: file extension (e.g., xlsx, zip). type_version: Used identify original dataset associated child data. Increment format variables change. multiple linelists one group, increment type. data_version: Used identify original dataset associated child data. Increment format variables change. Ensure document changes appropriate ‘data-raw’ file. language: Language code using ISO 639-1 codes (e.g., en, fr). country: Country code using ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 codes (e.g., tcd). scale: Geographic scale (e.g., subnational, national, international). subject: Main subject dataset (e.g., acute jaundice syndrome). context: Context data (e.g., outbreak, survey). fictional: dataset fictional (yes) real ()? year: Year data collected (e.g., 2016). earliest year dataset. description: Brief description dataset. Ideally, copy roxygen documentation. usage: Intended usage (e.g., {sitrep} walkthroughs, training). license: License dataset (e.g., gpl3, mit). group_identifier: EDIT - Created concatinating function excel. High-level identifier combining subject, context, country, year (e.g.,acute_jaundice_syndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016). unique_identifier: EDIT - Combines group_identifier, type, type_version, data_version, context, year create unique identifier (e.g. acute_jaundice_syndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016_linelist_1). example, adding Ebola dataset, enter information shown . original dataset (whether ’s {outbreaks} another source) considered type_version 1. ’s linelist group, remains type_version 1. completely different linelist added (just edited version), increment type_version accordingly. changes data (cleaning changing nums rows columns), increment data_version (e.g., data_version 2), type_version remains indicate ’s derivative (“child”) original. child dataset gets entry. dataset translated different language, create new entry translated version keeping data_version type_version , editing language column accordingly. ensures can trace back parent-child relationship datasets.

title: Linelist data from an outbreak of Acute Jaundice Syndrome (AJS) in Chad 2016 — AJS_AmTiman

title: Linelist data from an outbreak of Acute Jaundice Syndrome (AJS) in Chad 2016 — AJS_AmTiman
text: case-linelist contains de-indentified individual level data clinical, laboratory epidemiological information. can used together AJS_AmTiman_population, Blocksshape Quartiersshape. Please note, data adapted order best achieve training objectives. Also, GPS coordinates included dataset correspond real cases identified outbreak. generated exclusively training purposes.

title: Retrieve and Load Datasets — get_data
text: get_data function designed load specific datasets appliedepidata package based search criteria name, language, group_identifier, unique_identifier. function performs internal lookup identify appropriate dataset(s), loads assigns global environment. Depending type dataset (e.g., regular data frame, spatial data (sf), list), appropriate post-processing done ensure proper handling loading.

title: Retrieve and Load Datasets — get_data
code: get_data(   name = NULL,   language = NULL,   group_identifier = NULL,   unique_identifier = NULL )

title: Retrieve and Load Datasets — get_data
text: name (optional) string specifying name dataset load. language (optional) string specifying language dataset. used name, group_identifier, unique_identifier, function filter datasets based language. group_identifier (optional) string identifying group related datasets. provided, function return datasets within group unless criteria given. unique_identifier (optional) string representing unique identifier dataset.

title: Retrieve and Load Datasets — get_data
text: dataset(s) loaded global environment. Depending structure #' dataset, data frame, spatial object, individual list elements loaded separate objects.

title: Retrieve and Load Datasets — get_data
text: function operates follows: Dataset Lookup: performs internal lookup identify datasets matching search criteria provided. Loading Datasets: dataset found: attempts load dataset using data() function appliedepidata package. dataset loaded temporary environment avoid global environment clutter loading process. Post-Processing Based Object Type: dataset loaded, function checks type object handles accordingly: Data frames directly assigned global environment without processing. Spatial objects (sf class) processed using sf::st_as_sf() ensure correct handling spatial data, assigned global environment. Lists data frames split individual objects assigned global environment separate entities. dataset found loaded, function raise error.

title: Retrieve and Load Datasets — get_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load a dataset by name get_data(name = "AJS_AmTiman")  # Load a dataset by name and language get_data(name = "AJS_AmTiman", language = "en")  # Load datasets by group identifier get_data(group_identifier = "acutejaundicesyndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016")  } # }

List Datasets in a Package — list_data

title: List Datasets in a Package — list_data
text: data frame four columns: directory directory (data,extdata, intdata) file located. name name dataset found directories. extension file extension dataset found directories duplicate Logical vector (TRUE/FALSE) file name (extension) exists . flags second occurrence. useful packages built making .rda files internal

title: List Datasets in a Package — list_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List all files in the directories of the "ggplot2" package files <- list_data(package_name = "ggplot2") print(files) } # }

title: Lookup Dataset Information — lookup_dataset
text: function internal function used within get_data.R save_data.R functions. function helps retrieve information (tableoftables.xlsx) datasets based provided search criteria name, language, group_identifier, unique_identifier. returns dataset matches specified criteria suggests alternatives mismatches found.

title: Lookup Dataset Information — lookup_dataset
code: lookup_dataset(   name = NULL,   language = NULL,   group_identifier = NULL,   unique_identifier = NULL )

title: Lookup Dataset Information — lookup_dataset
text: name (optional) string specifying name dataset search . language (optional) string specifying language dataset. used name, group_identifier, unique_identifier, function filter datasets based language. group_identifier (optional) string identifying group related datasets. provided, function return datasets within group unless criteria given. unique_identifier (optional) string representing unique identifier dataset.

title: Lookup Dataset Information — lookup_dataset
text: data.frame containing dataset information matching dataset found. dataset found multiple datasets found details required (unless group), error message returned suggestions search refinement.

title: Lookup Dataset Information — lookup_dataset
text: function performs searches following order: Searching name: single dataset found name, function checks parameters like language group_identifier match dataset. match, suggests alternatives. multiple datasets found, additional filtering done based language group_identifier (specified). Handling incorrect language group_identifier: dataset found name, specified language group_identifier match, alternative datasets suggested based unique_identifier. Searching group_identifier: group_identifier provided, function returns datasets within group unless refinement language necessary. Searching unique_identifier: unique_identifier provided, function attempt find dataset identifier apply filtering language name needed.

title: Lookup Dataset Information — lookup_dataset
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Search by name lookup_dataset(name = "AJS_AmTiman")  # Search by name and language lookup_dataset(name = "AJS_AmTiman", language = "en")  # Search by group identifier and language lookup_dataset(group_identifier = "acutejaundicesyndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016", language = "fr")  # Search by unique identifier lookup_dataset(unique_identifier = "acutejaundicesyndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016_linelist_1_1_outbreak_2016")  # Search by name and group identifier lookup_dataset(name = "AJS_AmTiman", group_identifier = "acutejaundicesyndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016") } # }

text: Two data frames, 'Mortality Survey' 424 rows 16 columns, 'hh_member' 2874 rows 24 columns:

title: Fake data dictionary for a mortality survey — mortality_survey_dict
text: data generated functions epidict package created part R4Epis project funded Doctors Without Borders (MSF) sappling nursery. original dataset 'mortality_survey_dict.xlsx' version 1.0. dataset English. dataset licensed GPL3

title: Fake data dictionary for a mortality survey — mortality_survey_dict
text: fake data dictionary mortality_survey_data dataset. data dictionary originally ODK excel format using functions epidict transformed long format, can used recoding using matchmaker package. Please note, data entirely fictional created based Doctors without Borders (MSF) ethical review board pre-approved survey dictionaries. generated exclusively training purposes.

title: Fictional mpox linelist data from five European countries, 2022 — mpox_linelist
text: case linelist contains fictional individual level data five countries (country - E) clinical, laboratory epidemiological information. intended use part mpox case study, alongside mpox_aggregate_table (cumulative case totals date country).

what: Save Data Files to a Specified Directory — save_data
title: Save Data Files to a Specified Directory — save_data
text: save_data function saves dataset files (unzips necessary) based search criteria dataset name, language, group_identifier, unique_identifier. checks existence required files, files exist, either copied unzipped specified directory.

title: Save Data Files to a Specified Directory — save_data
code: save_data(   name = NULL,   language = NULL,   group_identifier = NULL,   unique_identifier = NULL,   path = rstudioapi::selectDirectory() )

title: Save Data Files to a Specified Directory — save_data
text: name (optional) string specifying name dataset save. language (optional) string specifying language dataset. used name, group_identifier, unique_identifier, function filter datasets based language. group_identifier (optional) string identifying group related datasets. provided, function return datasets within group unless criteria given. unique_identifier (optional) string representing unique identifier dataset. path (optional) string specifying directory dataset files saved. provided, function prompt user select directory via rstudioapi::selectDirectory() function.

title: Save Data Files to a Specified Directory — save_data
text: return value. function saves specified dataset files chosen directory. success failure message printed upon completion.

title: Save Data Files to a Specified Directory — save_data
text: function assumes dataset files available "extdata" directory appliedepidata package. function follows steps: Dataset Lookup: looks dataset information using lookup_dataset based provided search criteria (name, language, group_identifier, unique_identifier). File Existence Check: checks required dataset files exist using list_data function. files missing, error message lists . File Copying Unzipping: files found, function copies files specified directory. files zipped (.zip), unzipped saved.

title: Save Data Files to a Specified Directory — save_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Save a dataset by name to a chosen directory save_data(name = "AJS_AmTiman", path = "/path/to/save/directory")  # Save a dataset by group identifier and language save_data(group_identifier = "acutejaundicesyndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016", language = "fr")  # Save a dataset by unique identifier save_data(unique_identifier = "acutejaundicesyndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016_linelist_1_1_outbreak_2016") } # }

title: Search and Filter Datasets Available in appliedepidata — search_data
text: Launches interactive Shiny application allows users filter search dataset. Users can select language dropdown menu enter search query filter data displayed reactive table.

title: Search and Filter Datasets Available in appliedepidata — search_data
